Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Copsin (defensin; natural AMPs; fungi,fungii; UCSS1a; 6S=S; XXQ; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B. subtilis 168; S. pneumoniae, S. pyogenes, S. carnosus, S. epidermidis, L. monocytogenes WSLC 1042 or 1001, L. ivanovii WSLC 3009 or 2012, E. faecium DSM 20477, E. faecium VRE DSM 13590  (anti-VRE), E. faecalis DSM 20478, M. luteus, C. diphtheriae.Structure: The N-terminal Q is a pyroglutamate (XXQ).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.  The 3D structure has two antiparallel beta regions and two helical regions (see PDB annotation, Sequence). In addition, there are 6 disulfide bonds: C3-C32; C10-C40; C18-48; C22-C50; C25-C57; and C35-C54 that stabilize this small protein fold.MOA: copsin appears to inhibit bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding to lipid II.
Literature Information.Author: Essig A, Hofmann D, Münch D, Gayathri S, Künzler M, Kallio PT, Sahl HG, Wider G, Schneider T, Aebi M.2014
Literature Information.Title: Copsin, a novel peptide-based fungal antibiotic interfering with the peptidoglycan synthesis.
